qas.question: What organization works to further the understanding and adherence to the rule of law?
What types of economies does the IDLO focus on helping?
With how many countries does the IDLO work?
What organization focuses on studying rule of law?
Who focuses on empowering governments to establish laws?

plausible_answers.text: strengthen their legal capacity and rule of law framework for sustainable development and economic opportunity.

qas.question: What are Third World countries encouraged to do?
What is the only terminal organization with a mandate to enforce rule of law?

context: <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0><b6_0>The International Development Law Organization<b6_0/><b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> (IDLO) is an intergovernmental organization with a joint focus on the promotion of rule of law and development. It works to empower people and communities to claim their rights, and provides governments with the know-how to realize them. It supports <a1_0>emerging economies and middle-income<a1_0/> countries to <b5_0>strengthen their legal capacity and rule of law framework for sustainable development and economic opportunity.<b5_0/> It is the only intergovernmental organization with an exclusive mandate to promote the rule of law and has experience working in <a2_0>more than 170<a2_0/> countries around the world.
